definition[0]: one of a set of small open boxes fixed to a wall. You leave letters, messages etc for particular people in the boxes.
definition[1]: to unfairly consider a person, activity etc as belonging to a particular type or group
example[0]: Patsy was pigeonholed as a Country and Western singer, but thatâ€™s too simple.
definition[2]: to consider a person, activity etc as belonging to a particular type or group, in a way that is too simple and therefore unfair
example[1]: Electronic books and multimedia had originally been pigeonholed as a small, exclusive market.
definition[3]: one of a set of small boxes in a frame on a wall, in which you can put letters etc for people to collect, or one of a set of small boxes that are part of a desk
example[2]: I left a copy of the report in your pigeonhole.
